gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Geospatial Data Analysis, Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:metadataStandardName.gco:CharacterString: ISO 19139 Geographic Information - Metadata - Implementation Specification

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Density of sinkholes per square kilometer in southern Indiana and Kentucky, Derived from the 2011 Sinkhole Inventory: Indiana, 2011

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: This raster file was created to display in a geographic information systems (GIS) the density in square kilometers of mapped and modeled (indirectly mapped) sinkhole locations in southern Indiana and Kentucky.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: This data set was created to support a statistical regression analysis of potential sinkhole development areas in and around the Hoosier National Forest, United States Forest Service.This data layer is one of a suite of data layers: (1) sinkhole inventory point layer, (2) sinkhole density layer(s), and (3) sinkhole-development risk layer.

No attempt has been made in either the design or production of these data to define the limits or jurisdiction of any federal, state, or local government. These data are intended for use only at the published scale or smaller and are for reference purposes only. They are not to be construed as a legal document or survey instrument. A detailed on-the-ground survey and historical analysis of a single site may differ from these data. gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: This file is available to anyone, but access may be contingent on written request, specific terms relevant to the agency or person making the request and/or current freedom of information statutes in the state of Indiana.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: Prediction of potential areas of sinkhole development in southwestern Indiana using multiple regression analysis

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Geospatial Data Analysis, Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:environmentDescription.gco:CharacterString: Microsoft Windows 7 Enterprise; ESRI ArcGIS 10.0 (Build 3600), approximately 800 MB, TIFF image format

gmd:supplementalInformation.gco:CharacterString: A small portion of this raster density layer is located in northern Tennessee and has been retained because several points from the sinkhole inventory were included on the Kentucky/Tennessee border.

gmd:measureDescription.gco:CharacterString: Checks for duplicates (unique values in unique records) for the primary input data set, SINKHOLE_INVENTORY_IN_KY_2011.SHP, were performed on this data set.
This sinkhole density product used the sinkhole inventory dated November 28, 2011.

The values of sinkhole density calculated in this data layer are based on point locations contained in SINKHOLE_INVENTORY_IN_KY_2011.SHP. The following is excerpted from the metadata for that data set, "Sinkhole locations provided by external sources were not routinely checked, with the exception of those from Taylor and Nelson, 2008, which were compared to similar indirect mapping methods used in the digital line graph (DLG) contour-extraction methodology of mapping sinkholes. UTM X and Y coordinates represent the horizontal accuracy of the source data set:"

Accuracy is no better than that of the source material used to compile SINKHOLE_INVENTORY_IN_KY_2011.SHP, which was the primary input into the density calculation. In that layer, the horizontal accuracy varied from 1:2,400 to 1:300,000 (2 to 150 m), with the predominant accuracy of the sinkhole polygon centroids being between 10 and 12 meters.
The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Calculated the density of sinkholes in southern Indiana and Kentucky using a kernal density function implemented in ArcGIS v 10, Spatial Analyst Tools. The file SINKHOLE_INVENTORY_IN_KY_2011.SHP was used as the primary input, with a search radius of 1609.344 meters, and an output density in number of sinkholes per square kilometer. The output TIFF value raster had a spatial resolution of 30 meters.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Geospatial Data Analysis, Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:alternateTitle.gco:CharacterString: USGS IMG imagery, Indiana state boundary, Kentucky state boundary

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected.

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: Center for Geospatial Data Analysis, Indiana Geological Survey

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: Point locations of sinkholes in southwestern Indiana and Kentucky (and a few on the Kentucky/Tennessee border)

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: SINKHOLE_INVENTORY_IN_KY_2011: Sinkhole inventory for southern Indiana and northern Kentucky (Indiana Geological Survey, Point Shapefile), digital compilation by Sally L. Letsinger, 2011.

gmd:useLimitation.gco:CharacterString: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Metadata was created as or translated to ISO 19139 for inclusion in the Big Ten Academic Alliance Geoportal.
